line.token: * This file is part of the Symfony package.

* file that was distributed with this source code.
* HttpKernel notifies events to convert a Request object to a Response one.
* @param RequestStack $requestStack A stack for master/sub requests
'The request headers contain conflicting information regarding the origin of this request.'
* @throws \LogicException If the request stack is empty
* Handles a request to convert it to a response.
* @param int $type The type of the request (one of HttpKernelInterface::MASTER_REQUEST or HttpKernelInterface::SUB_REQUEST)
* @throws \LogicException If one of the listener does not behave as expected
* @throws NotFoundHttpException When controller cannot be found
'Unable to find the controller for path "%s". The route is wrongly configured.'
'The controller must return a response (%s given).'
// the user may have forgotten to return something
' Did you forget to add a return statement somewhere in your controller?'
* @param Request $request An error message in case the response is not a Response object
* @param int $type The type of the request (one of HttpKernelInterface::MASTER_REQUEST or HttpKernelInterface::SUB_REQUEST)
* @throws \RuntimeException if the passed object is not a Response instance
* Publishes the finish request event, then pop the request from the stack.
* Note that the order of the operations is important here, otherwise
* operations such as {@link RequestStack::getParentRequest()} can lead to
* Handles an exception by trying to convert it to a Response.
* @param int $type The type of the request
// a listener might have replaced the exception
// the developer asked for a specific status code
// ensure that we actually have an error response
// keep the HTTP status code and headers
